subject: How to start with JUnit [RE: [junit] a query]
msgSnippet: Hi, first you should know, that you have to dig in more advanced junit topics to cope with your task. For myself I read http://junit.sourceforge.net/ and the
messageBody:
Hi,

first you should know, that you have to dig in more advanced
junit topics to cope with your task.

For myself I read http://junit.sourceforge.net/ and the
JUnit-Cookbook as beginner. It's a simple starting point to
get into unittesting. Especially in your case I would suggest
you to get more acquainted with junit.

A more advanced book that gives a very deep understanding
of unit tests I found in "xUnit Test Patterns"
(Gerard Meszaros). That should give you the real taste of
junit without suffering the common junit beginner pitfalls.

In the second step you should be able to decide if you
use pure junit to take your task or to use a framework
additional, that may simplify some testing tasks in your
environment, for example to test http-communication.

best regards
Martin

> -----Original Message-----
> From: junit@yahoogroups.com [mailto:junit@yahoogroups.com] On
> Behalf Of novice junit
> Sent: Sonntag, 6. April 2008 18:40
> To: junit@yahoogroups.com
> Subject: [junit] a query
>
> Hi all Pros
>
> I am new to junit and have a task at hand. i need to build an
> automation test suite using junit to test these API. the
> api's called using http request ( its like
> http://api.xyz.com?a=0&b=1&.c=1
> <http://api.xyz.com?a=0&b=1&.c=1> etc...)and the response is
> returned in XML / json and php format.
>
> each response has to be parsed and take few of the parameters
> from the response and build a new http request and send it
> again. or call a different API with new param after I parse
> the first one.
> can anyone Suggest me any book, online doc etc for the same.
> and also get me started with this automation suite. how
> should I start with this task.
>
> any inputs will be very helpful.
>
> Thabk you very much !
>
> Cheers, S
>
> [Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
>
>
>
>
>
